messages.original:
In the Dobropillya direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces advanced, with Ukrainian forces continuing to recapture large areas northeast of Pokrovsk.
Ukrainian forces advanced in two areas. In the northeast, after Russian assault operations stalled, they advanced from the area of Sofiivka towards Poltavka and Rusyn Yar, recapturing positions in several different treelines and along two gulleys. 
To the southwest, Ukrainian forces advanced south and southeast from Volodymyrivka, capturing positions in three different treelines, and entering the northern houses of Novotoretske. Additionally, fighting continues for Pankivka, where the whole village is in the grey zone. 
Meanwhile, Russian forces continued to expand the western flank of their salient to Kucheriv Yar, and re-entered the village of Nove Shakhove, capturing positions in its eastern houses. Ukrainian forces continued attempts to enter Kucheriv Yar from the north. 
+ ~13.39 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~1.52 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Deepstate's latest update shows that Russian advances in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (Pokrovske direction) are not slowing.

Are we really going to continue to use maps showing fake advances? Ukraine failed to cut off the Russians in their salient to Kucheriv Yar and refocused further east after recapturing Volodomyrivka. 
Russia still holds Doroznje, while this map shows it 5 km behind the front line. This map is from someone called "Shalin", and the claims are based off Deepstate, old footage, and dubious claims that have been proven false time and time again. 
Also, I love how they still have it marked as Russia being encircled east of Kucheriv Yar after almost an entire month lmao.

Are we really going to continue to use maps showing fake advances? Ukraine failed to cut off the Russians in their salient to Kucheriv Yar and refocused further east after recapturing Volodomyrivka.   Russia still holds Doroznje, while this map shows it 5‚Ä¶

Footage showing two Russian Kh-38ML missile strikes on a Ukrainian crossing over the Oskil River near the village of Osynovo, Kupyansk direction.
Coordinates: 49.64260, 37.63548

Russian forces have captured the village of Obratne, Pokrovske direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~37.
Total land area: ~0.18 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Ternove, Pokrovske direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~316.
Total land area: ~1.50 km¬≤.
A large fire is burning in Vinnytsia City after it was hit by 1-2 Kh-101 cruise missiles this morning. What exactly was hit is currently unknown, but we may get FIRMS data showing active fires.

Sentinel satellite imagery shows that a section of the Vinnytsia Aircraft Repair plant was destroyed after Russian Kh-101 cruise missiles impacted it on September 10. 
Additional photos from the ground show this same area marked on the map.
Coordinates: 49.229771, 28.539321
Image credit: 
https://t.me/osint_alarm/312

Scenes from Zhytomyr City after it was hit by several Kalibr and Kh-101 cruise missiles this morning. The first image shows four impacts. The targets remain unknown, but interestingly, it doesn't appear Ozerne Airbase was hit.

Sentinel satellite imagery shows that the two targets hit in Zhytomyr Oblast by Kalibr and Kh-101 cruise missiles on September 10 were the "Progress Plant (site No. 2 ‚Äì foundry complex)", and a complex of warehouses. 
Factory coordinates: 49.886497, 28.644366
Warehouse coordinates: 50.319050, 28.635220
Image credit: 
https://t.me/osint_alarm/307

Warehouse coordinates: 50.319050, 28.635220

Footage showing a Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on a reported Ukrainian long-range UAV control point near Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast.
Explosion in Sumy. Impacted outside the city limits.

Syria And Israel Are Coordinating To Hunt Down Hezbollah, Quds Force Members 
Syria‚Äôs new Islamist-led Interim Government and Israel appear to be cooperating, or at least coordinating, to hunt down members of Lebanon‚Äôs Hezbollah and Iran‚Äôs Quds Force in the war-torn country.
The two countries have been engaged in talks for the last few months with mediation from the United States, and are reported to be preparing to sign a security agreement as early as this month. Signs indicating progress towards such an agreement, which would mainly aim to face the influence of Iran, appeared in recent days.
On September 11, Syria said that its security forces dismantled a cell affiliated with Hezbollah close to the capital, Damascus.
"Specialized units in cooperation with the general intelligence service‚Ä¶ were able to arrest a terrorist cell belonging to the Hezbollah militia that was active‚Äù in the Damascus countryside, a Syrian Interior Ministry statement said, quoting a local security commander.
Read more

Russia‚Äôs Molniya-2 Is Now Immune To Jamming With Fiber-Optic Guidance System 
The Russian military is testing a new version of the Molniya-2 fixed-wing drone equipped with a fiber-optic guidance cable that is completely immune to jamming.
Video footage showing the new version of the Molniya-2 being successfully launched during a test was posted to social networks on September 13, along with a photo of the large fiber-optic cable spool that was installed in the rear of the drone‚Äôs fuselage.
The Molniya-2 is made out of cheap materials like plywood, aluminum tubing and plastic. Due to its simplicity, affordability, and battlefield effectiveness, it has been nicknamed ‚Äúthe AK-47 Kalashnikov of drones.‚Äù
Read more 
HERE

Russian Troops Used Pipeline To Breakthrough Ukrainian Defenses In Kupyansk 
The Russian military broke through Ukrainian defenses in Kupyansk on September 13, with troops entering the city via an inactive gas pipeline in a complex and risky operation.
The breakthrough in the Kharkiv direction was first reported by Ukrainian media, including the Deep State channel on Ukraine, only to be confirmed later by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) which claimed in a statement that the situation in Kupyansk was ‚Äúunder control‚Äù.
Russian troops reportedly entered the pipeline ‚Äì the only one out of four leading to Kupyansk that was not flooded by the AFU ‚Äì from the settlement of Lyman Pershiy, more than four kilometers away. Work to set up the underground route reportedly took four days. Resting and resupply points were established along the pipeline.
Read more 
HERE

In Video: Russian Lancet Loitering Munitions Sink Ukrainian Drone-Carrying Boats
Video footage showing Russian Lancet loitering munitions sinking two Ukrainian drone boats in the Black Sea surfaced online on September 13.
It is unclear when exactly the strikes took place, but a day earlier the Russian Ministry of Defense said that eight ‚Äúhigh-speed uncrewed surface vehicles‚Äù were destroyed by the military‚Äôs Dnepr Group of Forces and the navy‚Äôs Black Sea Fleet over the past week.
The two boats seen getting hit in the footage appear to be versions of Ukraine‚Äôs latest Seawolf platform. Both were clearly equipped to launch first-person view (FPV) suicide drones.
Similar drone-carrying uncrewed boats have been used to attack the Crimean Peninsula on multiple occasions in recent months.

"Rats Fleeing a Sinking Ship": How Ukrainian Officials Save Their Children from Mobilization
A video investigation by Bihus.Info‚Äîa Ukrainian anti-corruption media project founded in 2013 by investigative journalist Denys Bigus‚Äîhas surfaced online. The team is known for exposing corruption schemes within the highest echelons of power.
In this investigation, Bihus.Info focuses on a key contradiction: while officials and public figures urge young people to remain in Ukraine, prepare for war, and "row in the same boat," their own children study at prestigious foreign universities. This exposes a system of double standards where patriotic rhetoric is directed at the general public, while the offspring of the powerful elites are ensured safety and quality education abroad.
Read more 
HERE
